reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: 1. Upgrade your package with the meal package. The dinner is extremely high quality and you can pick anything off the menu. We've eaten at very expensive restaurants around LA/OC and in Vegas and their restaurant rates right up there! Breakfast the next day is also included and again the food was excellent!
reviews.title: Stay & Play Package Worth the Bucks!"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. Golfing was excellent and really not that hard. We are beginners and our husbands shoot in the low 90's. We played all 3 nines and the last one was challenging. However, the day we played it was very hot even in the morning so we got worn out by the time we played the back nine. The Pro shop staff/starters are great in recommending which course to play. We managed to get in 72 holes with our one night stay.
reviews.title: Nice Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. If you golf, this is the place to stay. We wished we had planned a longer stay but were going on further south to play other courses.
reviews.title: Great getaway, especially if you're taking your dogs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: 4. If you're there more than 1 night, go to the casino down the road for entertainment. There is wine tours and old town Temecula to see as well during the day.
reviews.title: Great Golf Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will definitely come back!!!
reviews.title: Second Visit Better Than The First

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights when attending a wedding. Our check-in was effortless and we got in much earlier than scheduled. Since we were with the wedding party, a family member said our room had already been paid for. This was said in the presence of the front desk clerk and she didn't say anything to the contrary. She took our credit card, saying it was only for incidentals. After checking out, we realized that the room was not paid for. The front desk clerk should have known this when we checked in and we did not appreciate her inattention to detail on this point.
reviews.title: Nice, but probably not worth the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed in a room with 2 queen beds. The beds were wonderfully comfortable and we all slept well every night. The bathroom was large and had a nice assortment of toiletries. The drain in our shower was clogged and did not drain adequately so we called the front desk to have it serviced. We were told someone was on their way, but I'm not sure if they ever showed up because the draining never improved.
reviews.title: Nice resort, good vlaue, Dining better than average, comfortable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Our view from the room was ok, but we did not have nearly as nice a view as the rooms in the king bed building. The pool was small but decent enough for us as we were not there on a warm weekend.
reviews.title: Far away, right in town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I was thoroughly annoyed by the A/C in the room, as it ticked every 10 minutes or so and would only stop if you turned the unit off. When the unit was off, it got stuffy and hot though.
reviews.title: Outstanding accommodations professionally staffed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For two nights, our bill was $450 which we found to be completely outrageous, seeing as how this was not exactly an ultra luxurious, high end hotel. To make matters worse, that was the discounted wedding rate, so I can't imagine what these rooms normally go for. I would not stay here again unless I were rich and had money to burn.
reviews.title: Don't waste your money!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Temecula Creek Inn was a wonderful surprise. My wife and i are people who like nice things and i have no problem sacrificing a deposit if i show up and am disappointed with a hotel. This hotel reminds me of Carmel Valley Ranch or Quail Lodge in Carmel Valley, CA. It is a vintage California golf resort nestled in a wooded valley. Our room was exactly like the picture. Updated furnishings, carpet and drapes in the style of a a vintage lodge. The bathroom is a bit dated, but quite servicable. The dinner in the restaurant was excellent. I had the seared ahi and my wife had the halibut. The club house hs all the appointments and amenities one would expect in a classic golf resort.
reviews.title: An excellent hotel in Temecula

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I chose to celebrate our 40th anniversary at Temecula Creek Inn this past weekend using the "Stay and Play" package with the dining upgrade. All aspects of our visit were outstanding; the staff was courteous and attentive, the room was very comfortable with a complimentary bottle of wine to help us celebrate, and the dining experience was exceptional with a great atmosphere and exquisitely prepared meals. Unfortunately, we were unable to complete our round of golf due to a situation created by ourselves. However, the golf staff was very accomodating in honoring our request for a rain check to play our round of golf at a later date. It was a pleasant experience which allowed us to celebrate 40 years of a wonderful marriage. Thanks, Temecula Creek.
reviews.title: Enjoyable 40th Anniversary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite the negative reviews written, we decided to book a stay here this past weekend. I have no idea what the complaints could have possibly been about. Our room was clean and attractive, the bathroom was spacious and newly remodeled, the bed was VERY comfortable and the view... incredible. Food was delicious and staff friendly. Definitely would recommend and will return.
reviews.title: Great stay; absolutely beautiful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I am a seasoned traveler and spend 180 days in hotel rooms per year. My company was thinking of conducting a retreat at the Inn - Myself and two colleagues decided to make reservations and check out the place. From the get go nothing went smooth. The desk had our reservations mixed up. After several occupied rooms we were finally given rooms apart from each other whereas we specifically requested rooms in the same building and the same floor. The rooms smelled of mold and smoke. The furniture was beaten up, my sheets looked like they were tortured to fit on the bed. One of my colleagues had trash in the bathroom. The cleanliness leaves something to be desired. After trying their overpriced grill and fed up with the rudeness of the staff, we decided to leave before ourthird night, and when we complained at the desk it seemed no one cared. My company will neverdo business there. Their rooms are nothing like their advertising.
reviews.title: STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!!!SAVE YOUR MONEY!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently visited Temecula Creek Inn for a weekend. I purchased a package deal which included dinner and breakfast which was $309.00. When we arrived to the room "that looks nothing like the pictures online" the trash cans were full and there was no toiletries. The only upside to the room was the balcony and the view of the golf course. We had dinner and brunch at the Temet grill which was part of our package. Dinner was good but we were charged $109.00 for a corkage fee and a twenty dollar add on for a descent at best brunch the next morning. We also had to pay the tax for the 2 meals. Long story short Temecula Creek inn gives you the old bate and switch. What started out as a $309.00 night turned into a $455.00 night at a motel 6 with a golf course. Stay at South coast winery or Pachenga. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY.
reviews.title: Overcharged.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to go on a last minute getaway and didn't want to go too far (from San Diego, where we live). It was an incredible, relaxing trip. The restaurant was good (we ate breakfast there only, and we loved being able to wake up and watch the golfers from our private patio. The rooms were nice, clean, and had all the usual accomodations. Wine country is a quick drive away, so we visited the vineyards and restaurants there. Had a great time and would definitely go back for another visit.
reviews.title: Great getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was in better condition then our last visit-looked like it had recently been painted, new carpet. However, it was very impersonal-no pictures on walls, bathroom felt like it could have been in a prison, ect. Also, furniture did not look like it had been replaced. I had been told when booking the room that they had all been redone. Appreciated free Internet hookup. Radio had iPod connection. All of the staff members we dealt with were very nice, and it because of them, as well as the view from our rooms, that we will return.
reviews.title: Will return-in good location, room ok, great staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank You
reviews.title: Overpriced & Terrible Customer Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Richard Miller
reviews.title: The hidden gem to stay at and be pampered

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel was more than overpriced (spent well over $500 for a 2 day stay) and with terrible customer service as icing on the crappy cake. I've stayed at hotels for half the price where the rooms were more up to date and unbelievable customer service. I left my phone charger in my room and when we called to see if they could ship it, they asked for my credit card. REALLY?! After $500?! I got them to send it ground with no shipping. That was all they would agree to - and this was after 30 minutes on hold!
reviews.title: Lovely golf get away
